info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 6:56PM MDT until July 21 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
At 656 PM MDT, Thunderstorms recently produced heavy rain over the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar may result in debris flow moving through the Hanging Woman and O'Dell drainages. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and downstream of the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Birney, Birney Village and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation.
The heaviest rain has ended, but scattered thunderstorms with locally heavy rain are expected this evening.
info.instruction:
Life threatening flooding of creeks, roads, and normally dry coulees in and downstream of the Northern Remington and McGhee burn areas is likely. In addition to the flash flooding, the heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides, and debris flows in steep terrain.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
Remain alert for flooding of creeks, streams, and normally dry coulees even in areas not receiving rainfall downstream of the burn area. These can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes even from distant rainfall upstream.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE NORTHERN REMINGTON AND MCGHEE BURN AREAS REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN ROSEBUD COUNTY
